text: Hello, everyone! I'm trying to make a HubSpot integration using its api. Does anyone know where I can start from?
Hey <@UGMJVSHBJ> best place to start is our documentation <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/overview>
If you can give me a bit of detail about what you want the integration can do, I can provide some guidance on which APIs are best to use as well
Thank you <@UFBNA9K9A>
I'm trying to make a HubSpot integration interacting with SMS api and sell in HubSpot store.
But I can't find any solution where I can start.
<@UFBNA9K9A>, is it possible?

Sounds like you might want to look at the this <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview> which would allow you to put a card on the Contact Record  in HubSpot to send SMS messages on a one off basis
if you want to allow for programatic sending you can use this endpoint <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflow-extensions/workflow-extensions-overview>
Thank you <@UFBNA9K9A>
if want to send information about responses to SMS messages, your best best is likely <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/timeline/timeline-overview>
I will check.
That should get you started, but let me know if you have any questions
Thank you.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview>
This seems like same that I want to make.
But I can't find any detail in that page.
It shows only screenshots, request and response.
Yeah, that’s just an overview page, the detail is linked to from the sidebar
Not detailed steps.
Is there a source project for this tutorial?
At this point we don’t really have that kind of material
I see...
definitely something I want to put together, but right now it’s just reference material
I think I should use the crm extension api, but I'm not clear where and how I can start to implement.
Let me see if I can lay something out real quick, I’d love your feedback on what makes sense and what needs more clarification.  Stand by for the next few minutes
Thank you ! <@UFBNA9K9A>

1. Create a developer portal and create an app from <http://developers.HubSpot.com|developers.HubSpot.com>
2. This will allow you to define the meta data of CRM extension inside the app via a UI
3. This will also give you the information you need to complete the OAuth flow, which you can read more about here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/oauth2/oauth2-quickstart> with an example app here: <https://github.com/HubSpot/oauth-quickstart-nodejs>
4. Go through the oauth flow to install your app into a test portal (which you can spin up from the developer portal)
5. Create your server to receive the incoming webhook from HubSpot when you load a CRM record
6. Then inspect it on your server so you can see in practice what the API is sending out
7. Start to respond to HubSpot and see the results of that. I recommend using the IFRAME_ACTION to start with since it gives you a visual inside of HubSpot to see things
8. From there you probably have a good understanding of how the API works on the HubSpot side, then you can worry about adapting the information to how the SMS provider is expecting things
Hopefully that’s helpful, I’d be very grateful for any feedback on what isn’t though and where it can be improved/clarified
Thank you!
After check, I will be back. :slightly_smiling_face:
i might be blind in the documentation, but is there an endpoint for updating a workflow using the HubSpot Workflow API?
Hey <@UAQHN1F2Q> You are not blind, this endpoint isn’t there.  You mind saying what you want to do with that?  It will help in getting it opened and document

We have a client that's looking to automate creating some similarly structured workflows, but each with slight modifications that would be a bit time-consuming to setup manually.

I was more or less curious if an `update` endpoint existed since many of the other APIs have similar CRUD endpoints within their documentation.
Gotcha

<@UFBNA9K9A> I actually just thought of another use case for an `update` endpoint for the Workflows API.
Automating enabling/disabling a bulk of workflows.
